subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Call of Cthulhu fixes
msgSnippet: ... I tried to run it (and the previous .odt) through Pandoc, and this is what I got: $ pandoc -t html Call of Cthulhu-QS.odt pandoc: Cannot decode byte
messageBody:
On May 11, 2013, at 6:27 AM, Timothy <tim_rice09@...> wrote:

> Awesome. I fixed the typo (and another besides, "moment" was transferred as "movement" further down in the file) and am in the process of uploading the corrected set to qs-classics.

I tried to run it (and the previous .odt) through Pandoc, and this is what I got:

$ pandoc -t html Call\ of\ Cthulhu-QS.odt
pandoc: Cannot decode byte '\xab': Data.Text.Encoding.decodeUtf8: Invalid UTF-8 stream

What're you using to generate it? Is generating HTML (the plainer, the better) an option?
